intro: Prockia crucis, commonly known as the cross-leaf plant, is a rare and intriguing member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology, with leaves that are deeply lobed and often arranged in a cross-like pattern, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils, preferring sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, a common feature among members of its family. Prockia crucis is noted for its limited geographic distribution and is often found in specific regions of Europe and western Asia.
